results.title: Cinderella (Disney)
results.creator_credit: Clyde Geronimi, Hamilton Luske, Wilfred Jackson, Ben Sharpsteen, Walt Disney and Walt Disney Pictures
results.brief_description: Walt Disney’s animated version of Charles Perrault’s classic fairy story. Featuring beautiful colour animation and a lovely musical score this version of “Cinderella” is one of the Disney studios most charming and most loved cartoon features.

results.title: Ciliated thought
results.brief_description:
This project is based upon an exploration of themes and imagery from the novel “Bend Sinister” by Vladimir Nabokov.
Fragments from a story about love and loss…among other things.

results.title: Cicero: the queen's drum horse
results.creator_credit: Kevin Connor, Jack Le Vien, Terence Dudley and BBC
results.brief_description: A heartwarming and highly entertaining film tells the true-life story of the horse now known as Cicero, which is now in the forefront of Britain’s royal parades bearing the Queen’s silver drums. Tracing Cicero’s “rags to riches” adventures from Ireland to Scotland to England, the film culminates in the stirring pageantry of the annual Trooping the Colour.

results.title: Cigarettes and matches
results.creator_credit: Jerry Elder and Jerry Elder Productions
results.brief_description: Based on a chapter from the book “The Sun on the Stubble” by Colin Thiele. Evokes the Australian country and the people of the 1920’s by highlighting the relationships between members of a farming family and their friends. Cast includes Michael Moody, Timothy Edwards, Hetty Rollings, John Remynse. Suitable for primary and lower secondary levels.

results.title: Cigarette blues
results.creator_credit: Alan B. Govenar, Les Blank, Dallas Museum of Art and Flower Films
results.brief_description: As Texas blues singer Sonny Rhodes performs a song about a lover who died from smoking cigarettes, the film shows a sculpture made entirely of butts from the cigarettes which eventually killed the sculptor, Louis Bunce.

results.title: Churchill
results.creator_credit: Marisa Appugliese, Jeremy Bennett, ABC-TV (Australia), Arts and Entertainment Network and BBC-TV
results.brief_description: This magnificent four hour video explores the man behind the war image. With original archive footage of his home life, his extensive political campaigns and of the battles of two world wars, this outstanding film offers a vivid portrait of arguably the greatest statesman Britain has ever known.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Marisa Appugliese, Jeremy Bennett, ABC-TV (Australia), Arts and Entertainment Network and BBC-TV

results.title: Ciao Federico!
results.brief_description: This is a hour spent in the company of Frederico Fellini, unarguably one of cinema’s greatest figures. American filmmaker Bachmann was given unequalled access to the Maestro and his medium, following Fellini around during the shooting of “Satirycon”. Fellini displays all the attributes for which he was famous; he cajoles, implores, abuses and torments his cast and crew, behaves one minute like a tyrant and the next like a baby, displays grace and charm, and on occasions a touch of genius. It offers a fascinating portrait of Fellini at work.

results.title: Chuckwagon
results.creator_credit: Robert Barclay, Chetwynd Films and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: Produced in 1964, this film is a ringside view of the chuckwagon race, star attraction of the world-famous Calgary stampede. Once ponderous Percherons and Clydesdales thundered around the course. Now they are racers, and it takes a firm hand to guide such horsepower. “Chuckwagon” brings to the screen an exciting account of this extraordinary event. (Award: Cragnasco)
results.creator_credit_for_label: Robert Barclay, Chetwynd Films and National Film Board of Canada

results.title: Chronopolis
results.brief_description:
Chronopolis is a city lost in space. The inhabitants are immortal and they attempt to relieve their boredom by manufacturing time. They are all awaiting a liberating cataclysm which will break the monotony of their endless lives. During one of their manufactured moments, the Chronossians meet a human being in the person of a mountaineer.

Credits: Producer, Marcelle Ponti ; director, Piotr Kamler ; writer, Piotr Kamler, Gabrielle Althen ; photography, Piotr Kamler ; music, Luc Ferrari.
Cast: Michel Lonsdale [narration].

results.title: Christmas lace
results.creator_credit: George Mendeluk, Linda Sorensen and Ko-Zac Productions
results.brief_description: Animated at the beginning, this film is a Christmas story of a girl and her grandmother, both lacemakers, living in rural Quebec in the 1880s. A Christmas bowl left for the Baby Jesus one Christmas Eve is taken by a thief who eventually repays his debt. The film embodies some elements of French-Canadian culture. Special appearance by Monique Mercure and Marcel Sabourin. Cast includes Michael Cote, Guylaine Croteau, Germaine Lemyre and Roger Garand. Story by Linda Sorensen. Suitable for upper primary level.
